means: 相对：放在某事物对面以对比或平衡

sentence.Network_en: The army was ideologically opposed to the kind of economic solution proposed.
sentence.Network_cn: 军方从意识形态角度出发反对所提议的经济方案。

sentence.Network_en: He vociferously opposed the state of emergency imposed by the government.
sentence.Network_cn: 他激烈反对政府强行宣布进入紧急状态。

sentence.Network_en: She was adamantly opposed to her husband travelling to Brussels.
sentence.Network_cn: 她坚决反对丈夫前往布鲁塞尔。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 以o开头的英语英文单词 ... oppose 反对；反抗 opposed 反对的 opposite 对面的；相对的.
《Friends》词汇表A ... darn n.v. 织补 opposed adj. 反对的, 敌对的 functional adj. 功能的.
as opposed to some gypsies or travelling mexicans ., 相对于一些吉普赛人或常出外的墨西哥人.
航海及海运专业英语词汇(O2) ... opposed ram steering gear 对置柱塞式操舵装置 opposed 对置的 opposite angle 对角.

list.abs: 还有Gearbox，这个小组参与了针锋相对（Opposing Force）和蓝色沸点（Blue Shift）的制作。但还算是Valve的作品。
“反作用力”（Opposing Force）的使用给画面增添一种和谐有凝聚力的感觉。十字形中水平线起“制动器”（stopper）的作用，垂直线则 …
opposing cup 对口皮碗opposing reaction 对抗反应opposing torque 反向力矩
operator's telephone set 话务员用送受话器opposing connection 对绕opposite polarity 相反极性
opposing torque 反向力矩opposing wind 逆风opposite angle 对角

jx.jx_en_mean: distinguished from or in contrast with

lj.lj_ly: an approach that is theoretical as opposed to practical.
lj.lj_ls: 一种理论上而不是实践上的方法。

entry.def: If you are opposed to something, you disagree with it or disapprove of it.

example.ex: I am utterly opposed to any form of terrorism...
example.tran: 我坚决反对任何形式的恐怖主义。

example.ex: We are strongly opposed to the presence of America in this region.
example.tran: 我们强烈反对美国在该地区的存在。

entry.tran: 对立的；对抗的；相对的；相反的
entry.def: You say that two ideas or systems are opposed when they are opposite to each other or very different from each other.

example.ex: ...people with policies almost diametrically opposed to his own...
example.tran: 提出与他几乎截然相反的政策的人

example.ex: This was a straight conflict of directly opposed aims.
example.tran: 这是完全对立的目标之间的正面冲突。

entry.def: You use as opposed to when you want to make it clear that you are talking about one particular thing and not something else.

example.ex: We ate in the restaurant, as opposed to the bistro.
example.tran: 我们是在餐厅吃的饭，而不是在小饭馆。

means.word_mean: 1. in opposition to (a policy or attitude etc.);
2. being in opposition or having an opponent;

auth_sentence.content: Labour councillors locally are bitterly opposed to the decision.
auth_sentence.res_content: Labour councillors locally are bitterly opposed to the decision.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Labour councillors locally are bitterly opposed to the decision.

auth_sentence.content: Only a year ago President Obama opposed gay marriage.
auth_sentence.res_content: Only a year ago President Obama opposed gay marriage.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Only a year ago President Obama opposed gay marriage.

auth_sentence.content: The Iraqi government had opposed both of those measures.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Iraqi government had opposed both of those measures.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Iraqi government had opposed both of those measures.

Sentence.sentence: The rich are opposed to social welfare.
Despite this fact, many Americans are still strongly opposed to "big government.
Those who are opposed to it turn out to benefit most from it.

sentences.en: Their manager, to her credit, was always strongly opposed to the pay cuts.
sentences.cn: 他们的经理一向反对减薪,这使得她很有威望。

sentences.en: The path he saw himself taking in his research seemed directly opposed to the ethos of the department.
sentences.cn: 他发现自己的研究路线似乎与系里的精神截然不同。

sentences.en: I am not opposed to reform.
200 people attended, as opposed to 300 the previous year.
sentences.cn: 出席的有200人，而前一年是300人。

sentences.en: This exercise develops suppleness as opposed to strength.
sentences.cn: 这项运动不是增强力量，而是增强柔韧性的。
